title: Celebration Much? Video Shows Indian Square In New Jersey Littered After Diwali & It's Shameful
text:
Diwali is a festival which is celebrated by people all across the country, and even by Indians who leave overseas, far away from their motherland. It is called the festival of lights, but people have made it a ‘festival of firecrackers’! The aftermath of the festival is hazardous and despite so many campaigns to dissuade people from bursting crackers, there was very less, if any restraint shown on that front.

A video that is going viral on social media shows empty boxes, wrappers of firecrackers and other materials littered on the roads. No, not on Indian roads, but on New Jersey roads! A large crowd gathered at the India Square - where all the Indians celebrated Diwali.

You can see some people speaking in Hindi in the video and seconds later, a New Jersey police van is seen patrolling on the streets. The video was shared on Twitter with the caption, ‘Ashamed to be called an Indian. Last Night on Indian Street near Journal Square New Jersey. Hats off to NJ Police handling the mess Very professionally’.

Spitting and littering is all too common a sight in India, and a fine on people doing the same has been long awaited so that people think twice before littering. It is shameful that mature adults - in our country and abroad - still struggle with the concept of cleanliness. It is indeed disturbing, that the remnants of a glorious festival like Diwali, were litter and shame.
description: Diwali is a festival which is celebrated by people all around the world with joy and happiness. It is called the festival of lights but people have made it a ‘festival of firecrackers’! The aftermath of the festival is hazardous and even after so much awareness by the government, people do not care about the environment and burst crackers.
